intro: Eriocaulon laricifolium, commonly known as the pine-leaf spikerush, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of eastern North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that resemble pine needles, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Eriocaulon laricifolium thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs and swamps.
